energetic_polarity: classified as “hot”, vigorous, masculine, forceful plant
ritual_function: used to seal words, energize Ifá rituals, and consecrate oaths
sources: Verger, Pierre Fatumbi (1995). Ewé: o uso das plantas na sociedade iorubá; Wande Abimbola (1976). Voice of the Leopard; Bolaji Idowu (1962). Olódùmarè: God in Yoruba Belief; Henry Drewal, Margaret Drewal (1983). Gelede: Art and Female Power among the Yoruba;

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" plant, it calms, harmonizes, and restores equilibrium
ritual_function: used for stability, fertility, and reconciliation. In medicine and ritual baths (ọ̀sà)
habitat_character: near moist, shaded areas, at the base of trees or along the earth’s surface
sources: Verger, Pierre Fatumbi (1995). Ewé: o uso das plantas na sociedade iorubá; Wande Abimbola (1976). Ifá: An Exposition of the Ifá Literary Corpus; Abimbola (1977). Olódùmarè: God in Yoruba Belief; Delano, Isaac (1958) – Atumo Ede Yoruba;

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" and gentle plant
ritual_function: used for fertility, lactation, protection, and nurturing energy

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to soothe, cleanse, and renew

energetic_polarity: classified as "hot" to energize and awaken
ritual_function: used for revitalization, awakening, and protection
ifa_prescription: Odu Ògúndá Méjì, Odu Ìká Òfún

energetic_polarity: classified as "hot-dry" stabilizes instability or spiritual confusion
ritual_function: used to “fortify the feet” of travelers (fọwọ́ sí irin àjò), and in purification baths
sources: Verger, Pierre Fatumbi (1995). Ewé: o uso das plantas na sociedade iorubá; Wande Abimbola (1977). Awon Odu Ifá; Bolaji Idowu (1962). energetic_polarity: classified as "cool", grounding, and stabilizing
ritual_function: used to honor ancestors, marking renewal of lineage and gratitude

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to restores calm between disputing forces, and purifies intent
ritual_function: used to opens ritual spaces and mediates between humans and deities
ifa_prescription: Odu Òbàrà Méjì, Òsé Òtúrá, Ìrètè Òfún

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to pacify, strength, and preserve
ritual_function: used to stabilize, purify, and witness to the truth
ifa_prescription: Odu Ògúndá Òwónrín, Òfún Méjì, Òtúrá Méjì. In Òfún Méjì

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to calms heated emotions and purifies moral or ritual impurity
ritual_function: used to “wash away death” (wẹ́ ikú kúrò), negative dreams, or bad fortune. In community rituals it unites people after tension
habitat_character: near rivers, moist shade, and fertile soil

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to cool the Òrìṣà and calm heated conditions (fífọ̀rùn gbígbóná)
ritual_function: used to calm Òrìṣà shrines after sacrifice
ifa_prescription: Odu Òfún Méjì, Ìrètè Òtúrá. Òrúnmìlà
habitat_character: moist soil, partial shade, near human dwellings

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to calms excessive spiritual or emotional heat
ritual_function: used to restore equilibrium and attract gentleness, baths for good character, offerings for the head

energetic_polarity: classified as visible "cool" agent to “walks lightly” through the body and spirit, cooling fevers, anger, or agitation
ritual_function: used to restore peace between persons or between human and Òrìṣà after conflict

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to harmonizes energies and "refreshes the head"

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to reduce spiritual “heat,” anger, or confusion
ritual_function: used to harmonize the inner self
habitat_character: moist places near homes and shrines

energetic_polarity: classified as "cool" to calm the transition between the living and the ancestral realm
ritual_function: used to ancestral bath, rubbing the masquerade’s costume to cool and sanctify, protecting mediums entering trance, purifying spaces before Egúngún dances

energetic_polarity: classified as "hot" to confront spiritual attacks, competitions, legal problems, and adversarial forces
ritual_function: used to reach victory through perseverance and clearing difficult paths
ifa_prescription: Odu Ògúndá Méjì, Ògúndá Bèdè, Ìrẹtẹ Méjì
